Case reference: 2023039179.CaseDesc: Denis Taylor was last seen on July 22, 2023 at the Bulpit Lake Family Camp, located on Stringer Road in Carlow Mayo Township, East of Bancroft, Ontario. Denis planned to meet everyone in the common beach area after a brief nap in his cabin, which was located a distance away, but he never arrived. Denis may have woke up disoriented in the new cabin and taken the wrong path to the communal area.

Shirt: Blue, White, Long sleeve checkered shirt

Case reference: 2014004678.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1996, at approximately 4:30pm, Isaac and Sara Floresquintana were last seen at their mother’s home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002002.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1977, Gaetan Pichette was seen for the last time in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. His family and friends have not seen or heard from him since.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Arm tattoo, inscribed with "COCU"

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Bérénice and Bérengère Paré were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Bérénice and Bérengère, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date, the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2014001747.CaseDesc: On July 1, 1978, Brenda Bidner was seen for the last time in the Saint-Laurent District in Montreal, Quebec. She was known to travel frequently between Montreal and New York, in the United States. Brenda has not been seen and her family has not heard from her since.

Case reference: 2012020179.CaseDesc: This adult Caucasian female was recovered from a freight yard north of 127 Water Street. in Vancouver.

Case reference: 2006026399.CaseDesc: Kathy Anne Lulloff was last seen wandering off into the woods off Seabrook Lake Road in the District of Algoma.

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014006235.CaseDesc: A lake freighter capsized in a violent storm on Lake Winnipeg, just north of Hecla Island, Manitoba. The vessel carried nine crew members and one passenger. There was only one survivor who managed to float on a piece of the wreckage to safety. All of the bodies of the remaining occupants were recovered with the exception of Allan Clemens and Tache Everett who were never located. Autopsies confirmed that the causes of death for those recovered were either drowning or death due to exposure in the cold water. Allan and Tache are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014001028.CaseDesc: The body of this middle aged man was found in the Fraser River near Quesnel, British Columbia on May 20, 1968. He was well dressed and had custom orthotic supports in his shoes. He would have been born around 1920, had grey hair and likely had full dentures.

Other: Case, Leather case with nail clippers
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Pen Knife, Pen Knife
Leather, Black, Small key case with 15 keys
Shoes: Leather, Black, Pointed dress shoe with Dr.Scholl's arch support insole
Wallet: Brown, Light brown leather wallet with dark brown stitching

Case reference: 2014016821.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2014, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Wally Giesbrecht went for a walk from a local motel on the 16 Highway bypass in North Battleford, Saskatchewan. When he did not return to the hotel, his family searched the area, including the shoreline of the North Saskatchewan River and Finlayson Island's pedestrian trails with the assistance of the North Battleford RCMP, while the Fire Department conducted a water-based search of the river, all to no avail.

Shirt: Cloth, Grey, Car logo on back
Sweater: Black, Hoodie with a possible logo

Case reference: 2014046601.CaseDesc: Jason Beaupit has not been in contact with his family since September 2014. Mr. Beaupit was last seen on October 19, 2014, at a shelter in downtown Edmonton. He is known to travel and camp throughout British Columbia and Alberta.

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2012020084.CaseDesc: Kenneth Kettleson was an avid hunter and outdoorsman, and he led a reclusive lifestyle. Kenneth had not been seen for two weeks before he was reported missing. His residence was secure, and his vehicle was in the yard.

Case reference: 2014002959.CaseDesc: On December 1, 1998, Frederick Pilkington was seen for the last time near the Table Rock area in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Frederick was despondent.

Case reference: 2023046914.CaseDesc:
On August 22, 2023, Jasmine Laboucan was seen for the last time in Grande Prairie, AB.

Jasmine has a medical condition and may be confused or disorientated.

Case reference: 2014006470.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2001, Shahzad Ahmed was seen for the last time at his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Shahzad last contacted his mother by telephone to tell her that he had been fired from his job. During the course of their conversation, his mother had told him to return home to her apartment in Toronto, but he never arrived. The next telephone call that Shahzad’s mother received was from the Islamabad police in Pakistan, who had informed her that Shahzad’s luggage had been found unclaimed on the airport luggage carousel.

Case reference: 2013000003.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2011, James "Jamie" Lee was camping with several friends at the Smoky Flats Campground. Jamie was last seen by friends during the early morning hours when he went for a walk by himself.

Case reference: 2014005330.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2009, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Rose Mackinnon was seen for the last time when she left the Earnestine Women’s shelter with her two children. Rose advised that she would be returning but has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2015033938.CaseDesc: On the morning of June 27, 2015, Curtis Wilson was seen for the last time by a friend in Kelowna, British Columbia. Curtis had travelled from Alberta to British Columbia in a black rental car, model Chrysler 200. Subsequently, the rental was recovered in an area off Cosen Bay in the Kalamakla Provincial Park in Coldstream, British Columbia.

Shirt: Black, TSHIRT, Orange logo on front of shirt
Tattoo: Right Forearm, Skull in top hat 'Wicked'; skull outer forearm
Right Forearm, Skull with snake through it, $$ signs & flaming skull
Left Chest, Eagle head; upper chest
Left Forearm, Red & black scorpion on inside forearm
Right Upper Arm, Three skulls, inside bicep
Right Upper Arm, Skull, outside bicep

Case reference: 2012020143.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Lucie Bouchard was last seen driving her 1994 purple Honda Civic. She dropped her sister near Cremazie East and Saint-Michel Boulevard in Montreal, Quebec around 9:45 p.m. After that, she was expected to return home to Brossard on Montreal's south shore, but she never arrived. Lucie suffers from epilepsy and requires medication. She may have, on average, 2 to 3 epileptic seizures per month.

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2014045101.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an older adult female were found near Chasm, British Colombia in 2010. She had no teeth in her lower jaw and had likely gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2014001708.CaseDesc: Marlene Abigosis was last seen in March of 1984 in the downtown east side of Vancouver. Marlene was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Marlene was known to work near the docks, and clients that owned boats would take Marlene with them on trips to Washington State and Vancouver Island on occasion.

Case reference: 2018046052.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1997, Eric Wong was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Eric was in Canada continuing his education and had contacted his mother in October 1997 for help with his tuition fees.

Case reference: 2012020047.CaseDesc: Joseph Thomas Zerk was last seen on December 1, 2008 in Edmonton. He was facing some medical issues, and was sometimes homeless.

Case reference: 2014005112.CaseDesc: Tian You Li left his extended family home in East Vancouver to go for his routine walk. He never returned. He suffers from Alzheimers and may be confused and disorientated.

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2014006339.CaseDesc: Karen Kozicki was reported missing on May 13, 1996, after she failed to return home from place of employment in Edmonton, Alberta. Karen's vehicle was located on June 23, 1996, near Hanmore Lake, near the town of Smokey Lake, Alberta.

Case reference: 2006015899.CaseDesc: Pamela Holopainen was last seen in the city of Timmins, Ontario in the early morning hours of December 14, 2003, following a house party.

Case reference: 2013000075.CaseDesc: On December 15, 1988, Jean Berthiaume was seen for the last time in the Mount Royal area of Montreal, Quebec. Jean's vehicle was located at the Dorval Airport in Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Deformity: Right Arm, Smaller than the left
Scar: Right Upper Arm, "U" shape above the elbow

Case reference: 2023028547.CaseDesc: Maurice Boucher was last seen in the Montreal borough of Ville-Marie, Québec, on June 8, 2020. Maurice suffers from a number of health problems, including curved legs and has great difficulty getting around, walking with the aid of a walker or cane.  He is known for using housing resources for the homeless.

Case reference: 2014002462.CaseDesc: Michel Blanchette resided in north-Montreal and was seen for the last time on October 6, 1972. Late that evening, he went to "Taverne Duvernay" located on "Boulevard de la Concorde" in Laval where he went missing and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2013000006.CaseDesc: Joseph Taylor was last seen leaving his residence around midnight on July 30, 2001. He left his residence in a despondent state. It is believed he has started a new life and possibly a new identity for himself in the area around Kelowna in British Columbia. He may be working as a general labourer.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Sword with snake around (5cm)

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2014005768.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2012, Sol Han was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Sol did not show up for school.

Case reference: 2014004009.CaseDesc: On April 7, 1987, Dale Eldridge was seen for the last time as he went down to a river with some of his friends in Peace River, Alberta. Prior to that, Dale had attended a party.

Shoes: White, North Star, North Star brand running shoes

Case reference: 2018063453.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2003, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Senotta Thomas was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Senotta had left her home to go to work, but did not return home.

Case reference: 2020011480.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1988, Amerk Barbarian was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Amerk had been seen by his landlord for the last time when his rent was collected.

Case reference: 2012020094.CaseDesc: Gordon Harvey was last seen on July 24, 2008, at approximately 2130 hours. He was swimming in the Saskatchewan River near Cranberry Flats, south of Saskatoon, SK. Personal clothing and articles of identification belonging to Mr. Harvey were recovered on the shore near where he was last seen swimming.

Case reference: 2014002303.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1960, Herbert Lafferty was seen for the last time as he checked rabbit snares with his grandfather, just outside of Fort Resolution in the Northwest Territories. Herbert did not return from checking those snares, and some of his friends had reported that Herbert had indicated that he had made plans to rejoin his mother in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2014001584.CaseDesc: Alexander Petritsis was last seen June 30, 1994, in Montreal. He left his residence with his car, without saying where he was going to anyone. On that day, Alexander did not go to work.

Case reference: 2013000019.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2001, Terry Sagal was last seen leaving his South Regina house at approximately 11:00 am. Prior to leaving he took $50.00 cash and mentioned to his wife that he was going to get gas, pick up scotch and go to the Superstore. Shortly after leaving, Terry's Petro-Points card was used at the Albert South Petro Canada on a $26.00 purchase.

Case reference: 2020006644.CaseDesc: On July 6, 1980, Andrew Jenkins was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Andrew may have been despondent.

Scar: Left Side Of Neck, Two inches

Case reference: 2014036537.CaseDesc: On 2 October 2014, a vehicle was located abandoned at 53122 Range Road 194 in Yellowhead County, Alberta. The investigation concluded that Natasha Klok was an occupant of that vehicle and that she went into a nearby heavily forested area. Natasha has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014006111.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2013, Holly Balzer was reported missing from Calgary, Alberta. Two months prior to her disappearance, Holly last spoke to members of her family.

Deformity: Mouth, has no teeth - sometimes wears dentures
Foreign Object: Left Ankle, pins from a leg break

Case reference: 2020009578.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1989, at approximately 1:00am, Andrew Gunzinger was seen for the last time leaving his girlfriend’s father’s farm near Orangeville, Ontario. Prior to leaving, Andrew and his girlfriend had gotten into a dispute.

Case reference: 2014004104.CaseDesc: In August of 1977, Jonas Haineault, was visiting family in Lymburn, Alberta. Jonas departed by bus from nearby Hythe, Alberta for Edmonton, Alberta. This is the last his family had heard from him and it is unknown whether Jonas arrived in Edmonton.

Case reference: 2006022599.CaseDesc: Edwin Scherer was last seen while on a hunting trip at Cedar Point Lodge on Gordon Lake. He was on vacation at the time and was a resident of Wisconsin, U.S.A.

Jewelry: Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, watch with 3 black stones
Gold, Blue, Ring, large blue stone
Shirt: Wool, White, Black, lumberjack style; dirty
Vest: Brown, Orange, hunting vest with orange on the shoulders

Case reference: 2014002414.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1983, Michael Milavanov and his father were canoeing on Kingsmere Lake near Waskesiu, SK. The canoe tipped over in rough water. His father survived however searches failed to locate Michael.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2012020088.CaseDesc: Norbert Couillonneur was last seen on Thursday, May 27, 2010, at Pinehouse Lake, SK, wearing blue jeans and a light blue t-shirt. He is known to travel back and forth from Pinehouse Lake to Canoe Lake, SK.

Case reference: 2020008536.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1982, Heather Newton was last seen after she was discharged from the Queen Street Mental Health Centre in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000055.CaseDesc: Ronald Donelle has been missing since November 16, 2001. He was last seen dropping off his ex-wife in front of her home located in the Pierrefonds-Roxboro district in Montreal, Quebec. His vehicle has not been located.

Case reference: 2014005728.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2011, James Mayer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. James had last spoken with his mother on December 14.

Case reference: 2020016353.CaseDesc: In April 2020, Travis Hollar last contacted his family. During the time of his disappearance, Travis was residing in Edmonton, Alberta, and was living a transient lifestyle. In the past, he suffered from a brain injury which caused diminished cognitive abilities.

Case reference: 2024006090.CaseDesc: Beverly Musick was seen for the last time in the area of the Seneca Casino in Niagara Falls, New York, USA on June 8, 2004.  The next morning, her personal belongings were located on Luna Island, NY. At the time of her disappearance, Beverly was feeling despondent.

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2014005501.CaseDesc: On October 7, 2010 around midnight, Fred Byram was last seen exiting the Rockin Rodeo bar and getting into a taxi on Elmwood Drive in Moncton, New Brunswick.

Hair: Grey, Brush Cut, Salt and Pepper hair, 2-3-day stubble
Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Blue wolf and moon with tree
Right Wrist, Barbwire, green and grey

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Straight, Dyed, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2014005870.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2012, André Bellemare was last seen by his wife at his residence in Trois-Rivières, QC. On May 24, 2012, Mr. Bellemare’s vehicle was found abandoned in the woods near the ZEC Tawachiche territory, located in the municipality of Lac-aux-Sables. Despite the discovery of the vehicle, so far the searches have been unsuccessful in locating Mr. Bellemare.

Shirt: Cotton, Blue, White, Plaid, size XL
Shoes: Brown, Size 10, Treking North Face brand

Case reference: 2010001199.CaseDesc: Michael Hinsperger was in a canoe on Carson Lake, Barry's Bay, at 3:00 P.M. on May 13th 2010. The canoe was recovered but Mr. Hinsperger has not been located.

Jacket: Black, Yellow lettering "Harley Davidson Owners club"

Case reference: 2014004451.CaseDesc: On February 22, 1964, Marie Mike was seen for the last time leaving a residence on the Beardy's/Okemasis First Nation Reserve near Rosthern, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014003009.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 30, 1979, Adolphe Thorassie and three hunting partners were attempting to return home after a successful hunt. Two men were in each boat. On the return trip the men had to go to shore once to get out of the winds. They again departed despite the high winds on the lake which was causing the water to be extremely dangerous with high waves. Adolphe was in the lead boat with his hunting partner, and unbeknownst to him the second boat had to return to shore for motor repairs. Adolphe and his hunting partner never returned and were reported missing the next day. The body of Adolphe's hunting partner was discovered and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. It is assumed Mr. Thorassie also drowned.

Case reference: 2013000085.CaseDesc: On April 17, 1994, Jose Fernandez was seen for the last time at his residence in the Villeray district in Montreal, Quebec. Following a disagreement, Jose left home in his car without saying where he was going. The vehicle was a red, 4-door Mercury Capri.

Case reference: 2015011664.CaseDesc: On July 6, 1994, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 25-35 was found in the waters of the St. Lawrence River near the Old Port of Montreal Clock Tower in Montreal, Quebec.

Sweater: Cotton, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Fruit of the Loom brand, T-shirt with short sleeves, faded, size medium
Scar: Right Hand, 2.4 cm at the base of the thumb

Case reference: 2014003913.CaseDesc: Martin Maier was last seen on May 4, 1973, leaving the local hotel in Prelate, Saskatchewan at approximately 1:00 a.m. He was driving a red 1971 Chevrolet half-ton pick-up Saskatchewan license F133013 with a white camper on the cargo box.  Extensive searches have been conducted, however neither Martin or his vehicle have been located.

Sweater: Wool, Other, Siwash brand with a fish design, knitted

Case reference: 2012020069.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1982, a Gimli resident reported that in 1972 Debbie Richardson arrived in Gimli to visit her brother.  According to this report, she stayed with him for approximately three months, then went missing. Debbie's brother last saw her in September, 1972, when he dropped her off on a highway so that she could hitchhike to Winnipeg.  She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2023001519.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2023, Krystal Russell was reported missing. The last footprint of life for Krystal Russell is December 31, 2022.

Case reference: 2014004125.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1979, the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP Detachment received a report that David Voisey had gone through the ice while riding as a passenger on a snowmobile near Epinette Point, North West River, Newfoundland and Labrador. Mr. Voisey  has never been located.

Case reference: 2013000017.CaseDesc: In August 1983, Jannisina "Jan" Stonehouse left her home in Oakville and has not been seen since. She may have left home due to being pregnant.  Jannisina may have been in the company of Darlene Tucker who is also missing. Refer to case 1993001330

Teeth: Good, Four teeth treated (one tooth had partial nerve treatment), one tooth absent lower left jaw. Dental chart on file.

Case reference: 2012020142.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2008, Shannon Alexander, 17 and Maisy Odjick, 16, were reported missing from the First Nation community of Kitigan Zibi in Quebec. This community is located near the town of Maniwaki. On September 5, 2008, the two girls went to the Maniwaki arena, where several young people were present. Maisy then went to spend the night at Shannon’s house. Shannon’s father was the last person to have seen his daughter on September 6, 2008. In 2015 an age progression was done for both Maisy and Shannon.

Pierce: Mouth, 2 loops on the lower lip

Case reference: 2013000136.CaseDesc: Mr. Joseph Moore was last seen on October 31, 2012 by his employer in Kincardine, Ontario.  He was reported missing on November 12, 2012. Upon investigation, Joseph's apartment was found neat and tidy and his clothing and luggage had been left behind. Joseph is known to suffer from severe cases of depression. The last potential sighting was at the Kincardine Davidson Centre on November 8, 2012.  A media blitz was done to request feedback for missing person Joseph Moore with limited feedback. An extensive search of the area was conducted with negative results.

Case reference: 2013000125.CaseDesc: Bonnie Joan Thomas (née Cooper) of Rollingdam, just outside of St. Stephen, NB, met with some friends and went across the U.S. border to the Legion in Calais, Maine.  They went to a St. Patrick's Day dance. After the evening's celebrations, Bonnie left the Legion alone in her red 1973 Volvo station wagon. She drove back through the Calais/St. Stephen border crossing into Canada. At the Canadian entry point Bonnie hit the customs booth causing minor damage to her car. She was last seen talking to the Customs Officer. The next morning her husband realized she was missing, and called the police. Bonnie's car was found abandoned on March 18, 1978, near St. Stephen on a logging road near the St Croix River.

Case reference: 2014004349.CaseDesc: Candace Giebel was last seen on August 1, 2002. She may have left Vancouver with her boyfriend at that time; her whereabouts and destination are unknown. Her family has not heard from her since her disappearance.

Case reference: 2016068940.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2016, Cory Lanteigne was reported missing by family members after having gone out for a short walk, and never returning. He was not dressed for the weather conditions at the time and was experiencing a mental health crisis. An extensive ground search was conducted by police in the area where he was last seen but failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2012020034.CaseDesc: The Edmonton Police Service is seeking assistance in locating Dylan Steven Koshman. He was last seen on October 12, 2008 on the south side of Edmonton.

Case reference: 2014004925.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2007, Michael Bailey was last seen by the Thunder Bay Police on Bowlker Road in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Michael is known to travel on foot, and avoided being around people. During the time of his disappearance, he was living a transient lifestyle, and camped in wooded areas.

Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Blue, BUSH, Flannel jacket in the colours grey, blue, beige and brown
Shoes: White, Orange, RUNNERS, Running shoes in the colours white, orange and navy blue
Sweater: Blue, HOODIE, Hooded sweater in the colour navy blue

Case reference: 2006004799.CaseDesc: Ralph Monague and Curtis Smith were passengers on the Christian Island Ferry travelling between Cedar Point and Christian Island on December 22, 1985, when they fell over board in stormy conditions.

Case reference: 2014004448.CaseDesc: Carmelo Tomasino was last seen on January 19, 2004 in Montreal. His absence and not calling home is out of character.

Tattoo: Chest, Hearts with the names Amanda and Brenda

Case reference: 2018008750.CaseDesc: On February 17, 2018, Ryan Shtuka was last seen at approximately 2:10 am and was believed to have left a party on Burfield Drive to walk home to his residence located a short distance away in Sun Peaks. Ryan did not attend his job as scheduled later that day and has not been active on social media or his cell phone since.

Shirt: White, Grey, Button Up, Grey arms and collar, partial button up
Shoes: Size 11, flat bottom sole shoes similar to VANS

Case reference: 2020008535.CaseDesc: On March 6, 1991, at approximately 1:00pm, Martin Stocker was last seen at his retirement home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020126.CaseDesc: Rollande Doherty, 52 years old, disappeared on February 2nd 2007. She was last seen around 2:30pm near the library in Rouyn-Noranda.

Case reference: 2018041446.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1998, Richard Opato was last known to be in the region of Niagara Falls, Ontario at approximately 5:30 p.m. There has been no news of his whereabouts or well being since this time.

Hair: Brown, Short, Other, Losing hair on the top of his head

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2014006256.CaseDesc: Christopher Maier lives in Saskatoon and traveled to Regina, Saskatchewan in December 1994 to visit family and friends. He was believed to have returned to Saskatoon after his visit, although this has not been confirmed. Christopher has not been seen since and was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on September 18, 2013.

Pierce: Ears, He had one piercing in his right ear.
Scar: Forehead, The scar was L shaped. No actual size of the scar is available.

Case reference: 2014002284.CaseDesc: Richard Reitmeier has not been heard from or seen since the fall of 1988. There is not much known surrounding his disappearance.

Case reference: 2013000103.CaseDesc: Peter Bighetty was last seen on September 20, 1969 departing from Jackpine Island for Brochet Island via Reindeer Lake in Manitoba, with two fellow commercial fishermen.  Peter was travelling by canoe ahead of the two other men when their canoe had a mechanical problem and had to stop on an island.  Peter was never seen again and his canoe was located in Reindeer Lake in a vertical position 9.6 kilometres south of Brochet, Manitoba. It is presumed Peter drowned and no foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2010003499.CaseDesc:
On March 21, 2010 Chung Law left work on Dundas St, London ON. He told his employer that he was experiencing some stress and would be taking a couple of days off. Mr. Law spoke to his wife, who lives in Vaughan, ON, and told her he was coming home for a visit. He spoke to his employer the next day, saying he was in Toronto and that he did not want to return to work in London. Mr. Law never did arrive home. Investigation has revealed that Mr. Law may have travelled to Toronto by bus. 

In April, 2011 a right foot contained within a black boot was located in the river flats of the Thames River in Elgin County. The area was searched and no further remains were found. DNA confirmed that the foot was that of Mr. Law.

Scar: Left Thigh, Surgery scar on upper left thigh

Case reference: 2014001462.CaseDesc: On August 18, 1995, Gareth Austin and Dominic Park were seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Scar: Left Hand, Scar top of left hand

Case reference: 2014002472.CaseDesc: In April 1988, Stacey Rogers was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Taylor, British Columbia. Stacey had stated that she was planning on travelling to Edmonton, Alberta, but did not go to Edmonton. It is possible that she went to Grande Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014003846.CaseDesc: On March 1st, 1992, Blaine Prince and his friend were on a ski-doo on the river with two other friends. As they were driving on the river the lead ski-doo encountered ice that gave away however they accelerated to stronger ice. Mr. Prince and his friend were not as lucky and broke through the ice. Both men were observed hanging onto the edge of the ice however Mr. Prince soon let go and did not re-surface.

Case reference: 2014002960.CaseDesc: David Wycotte was last seen by his family on November 1, 1975, in Williams Lake, British Columbia. Up until December 1975, David was working in Winfield, British Columbia as a berry picker. David has been known to travel the area and the United States looking for labour jobs.

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003380.CaseDesc: On May 9th, 1961, Brenda Byman was last seen on a hike with some classmates in the area of Wilmer, British Columbia, when she allegedly walked off into the bush and did not return. Brenda has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Blue, Parka, With pink hood

Case reference: 2014005585.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Amanda McLeod was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000086.CaseDesc: On July 24, 1992, Ramsey Jason Seng was seen for the last time in the La Petite-Patrie district of Montréal, Quebec. He may be in Cambodia.

Case reference: 2024018918.CaseDesc: Benjamin Sullivan was reported missing on April 21, 2024 from Moncton, New Brunswick.  Benjamin has not been seen or heard from since July 2023. Benjamin is known to live a transient lifestyle and does not have a fixed address. Extensive searches around the City of Moncton, including verifications at shelters and hospitals have been unsuccessful in locating Benjamin.
